alert.note: Alert for Florence; Forest; Langlade; Marathon; Northern Marinette County (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 3:20AM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS EXPECTED TODAY INTO TONIGHT... .A strong winter system will move north into the Great Lakes. Areas of freezing drizzle will precede the snow, resulting in icy roads, especially over northern Wisconsin. Light snow will continue to overspread the region this morning. The snow should remain light in most areas through early afternoon, then become moderate to heavy later this afternoon into early this evening. The bulk of the accumulating snow will fall late this afternoon and evening. Wind gusts from the northeast to north will also increase to 30 to 40 mph during the late afternoon into this evening, reducing visibility and resulting in patchy blowing and drifting snow in open areas. The greatest accumulations are expected in the eastern Fox Valley and lakeshore areas, where some lake enhancement is anticipated. Hazardous travel conditions will develop, with the worst conditions occurring during the afternoon and early evening. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. Ice accumulations less than a tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will create patchy blowing snow and low visibilities for motorists. * WHERE...Marathon, Langlade, Florence, Forest, and Northern Marinette County Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Florence; Forest; Langlade; Marathon; Northern Marinette County
